text: How is this a movie adaptation of a book and yet the dialogue sounds like it was written by a 12 year old for their drama class?!? I was hoping for a mindless movie with beautiful scenery and maybe a saccharine love story but this was 1 hr 45 mins of pure nothingness, even the nature shots weren’t that great, like a film student with a drone. Waste of my time, should’ve turned it off but hoped it might pick up and get better. Shame on all involved, what a disappointment! Now wondering if I should even bother with Katherine Center books.
Love this movie sooooo much

One of the best, if not the best movie I have watched this year. 10/10. Not sure what the critics look for in a good movie.  No CGI, but not needed to make it good. I was skeptical because of the reviews, but found the chemistry of the characters, the actors and the story to be enlightening and provide the essence of change, goodness, happiness, and forgiveness. Thank you for such a good movie.
This is a bad movie. And if you read the book, this is a terrible movie VERY loosely based on the very good book.

Didn't know this was based on a book so came in without any expectations. It's no masterpiece but I found it thoroughly enjoyable. The characters had their own quirks, nothing too deep going on but fun and funny. The ending was very clear from the start but I didn't mind the journey to get there. Perfect rainy day movie.
The book was so much better. They kinda ruined it

This movie was…cute. Trashing it feels like picking on the little kid at school. Yea he’s probably annoying and nerdy but he’s harmless so just leave him alone lol. That’s how I feel about Happiness for Beginners. It doesn’t seem like director and writer Vicky Wight was going for movie of the year with this one. Simple settings, simple story, simple love. There’s a lot left to be desired but overall I’m not mad I watched it.

Happiness for Beginners is a strange movie because it should have been a light & fluffy Hallmark-style rom-com, but for some reason they decided to throw in a few words and references to make it PG-13 and that salt kind of ruins the sweet. Also, Ellie Kemper’s character comes off a little too ornery and it makes her somewhat unlikeable. The rest of the characters each have a fun moment or two, but they’re mostly just scenery, and the plot takes the well-worn trail of many romantic comedies that came before it. I wasn’t as annoyed with Happiness for Beginners as I thought I might be. It’s fine.

I've seen other movies with much better RT scores from audiences, movies that weren't nearly as good as this film is, and this film isn't even well rated so far. I don't quite get that because it is a pretty decent RomCom with a nice Love Message to it. Bottom line? A happy moviegoing experience begins here.

Love a rom com, absolutely hated this! Boring, story was pretty grim and mostly main characters lack any chemistry.  Because of grimes I had high hopes, but I hated every minute of this film! The love story between them was utterly unconvincing.  I’ve seen better hallmark movies to be honest.  Feels like a low budget amateur film made by a group of high schoolers for a school project.
Light hearted, charming characters, easy watch.

Rubbish romcon that is basically a load of people who should never have gone into the wilderness as they gave no idea about how to survive, if anyone follows their methods in real life they could get themselves and others killed!
So cute! One of my favorite movies because it’s so feel-good. And Luke grimes!! 😍

It may be formulaic in that romantic comedy way but it stills gives you lots of cozy moments that you can watch over and over again.  Makes me want to go on a hike with some randos in hopes of self-discovery...and some good laughs.
Slow going, I might watch it again as background noise. If you are expecting Luke grimes from Yellowstone you will be let down.
A bear attack at the end would have been the only thing to save this awful movie.
The type casting and script are so awful it would have been unwatchable if it was made in 2004.
Pretty dreadful.  Time I’ll never get back
Love this movie! The film was perfectly cast and the chemistry between the leads is wonderful. Highly recommend

So the book “Happiness for Beginners” written by Katherine Center was SOOO good ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️! Sadly the movie was extremely disappointing. It didn’t stick to the storyline of what actually took place. The movie left out so much of what made the romance and connection so beautiful in the book. I also agree there was no chemistry between the main characters.
